objective:
Objective:

Learn how to enhance accessibility by adding labels to give extra context for a grouped input field using the Invisible Text and ariaLabelledBy.
task:
Task:

You are given an initial code where a Label and two input fields are created but not properly linked.

Use invisible texts to link each input to the appropriate description.
instruction:
Instruction:

In the file /webapp/exercises/Exercise05.fragment.xml add two InvisibleText controls to describe each input field and link them by the ariaLabelledBy property on each Input control.
howToTest:
How to test:

  • Use NVDA (Screen Reader) to inspect the Input Control. It should vocalize each dedicated Label when its Input Control is focused.
helpCode:
<core:FragmentDefinition
  xmlns="sap.m"
  xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
  xmlns:form="sap.ui.layout.form"
>
  <form:SimpleForm
    id="idExercise05SimpleForm"
    editable="true"
  >
    <Label
      id="idPostalCodeCityExercise05Label"
      text="{i18n>Exercise05.fragment.form.label}"
    />
    <Input
      id="idExercise05PostalCodeInput"
      //Take a look at ariaLabelledBy association for sap.m.Input control
      value="12345"
    />
    <Input
      id="idExercise05CityInput"
      //Take a look at ariaLabelledBy association for sap.m.Input control
      value="Sofia"
    />
  </form:SimpleForm>

  //Take a look at sap.ui.core.InvisibleText control
  //Take a look at sap.ui.core.InvisibleText control
</core:FragmentDefinition>
